1.text: And the Spirit says expressly, that in later times some shall be removed from the faith, holding to deceitful spirits, and doctrines of evil spirits;

2.text: In the hypocrisy of speaking falsely; burned with a hot iron in their own consciousness;

3.text: Hindering to marry, to keep from victuals which God created for participation, with thanks, for the faithful and them knowing the truth.

4.text: For every created thing of God good, and nothing thrown away, received with thanks:

5.text: For it is consecrated by the word of God and entreaty.

6.text: These having laid down to the brethren, thou shalt be a good servant of Jesus Christ, brought up in the words of faith and good doctrine, which thou hast closely followed.

7.text: And profane and old womenâ€™s fictions reject, and exercise thyself in devotion.

8.text: For bodily exercise is profitable, to little: but devotion is profitable to all things, having promise of life now, and that about to be.

9.text: Faithful the word, and worthy of all acceptance.

10.text: For, for this also we are wearied and reproached, that we have hoped in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, chiefly of the faithful.

12.text: Let none despise thy youth; but be thou a type of the faithful, in word, in intercourse, in love, in spirit, in faith, in purity.

13.text: Till I come, hold to reading loud, to entreaty, to doctrine.

14.text: Neglect not the power which in thee, which was given thee by the gift of prophecy, with the putting on of hands of the council of elders.

15.text: Bestow diligent care upon these things; be in them; that thy progress may be manifest in all things.

16.text: Take heed to thyself, and to the doctrine; remain in them: for doing this, and thou shalt save thyself, and them hearing thee.
